website_summaries.verdict: A low-priced jewelry cleaner that produces high-quality results.
pros: Gentle on everything from expensive jewelry to reading glasses
With just a little warm water and a drop of dish soap, this jewelry cleaner brings back that day-one shine
We love how quickly it takes off layers of built-up lotion and sweat –just one three-minute cycle
Even the small, intricate parts of jewelry are free of dirt and grime after being washed with this machine
cons: There are no customizable cleaning times – only one setting available

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic deal for the price. Add hot water and a drop of Dawn to the tank to clean just about anything that can fit in it. My glasses have never been so clean! Of course, it is perfect for jewelry. The only complaint is that it has a on button that is preset for about 3 minutes. It would be better if I could set the cleaning time myself. That said, I'd buy it again without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Wifeybo

customer_reviews.title: stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Mine arrived on June 2nd. It is now December 6th and it had stopped working. I have used it approximately 2 times a month for 6 months. It still lights up when I plug it in but when I push the on button nothing happens.
customer_reviews.author: James O. Whitehead

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing!! Although I used bottled water only
customer_reviews.text: Works amazing!! Although I used bottled water only, with a few caps of blitz gem and jewelry cleaner it cleaned my wedding rings to look brand new! I usually go to my jewerler to clean my rings and they suggested this cleaner. I highly recommend this product!!
customer_reviews.author: Angela Rozanek

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and decided to give it a shot since the necklace I wanted to clean is very dainty sterling silver. I should have known it wasn't good when the instructions included were written for a completely different machine, but it looked fairly easy to use. I assumed these things are not so different from the operational perspective so I didn't think machine specific directions were necessary. I followed the included instructions and the machine did not work at all. It kinda reminded me of a car with aftermarket exhaust...sounded loud to give the impression it's working, but it's really not. I returned and requested a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Maryann Payne

customer_reviews.title: Cleans very well
customer_reviews.text: This works great. I've had it for several months and it's going strong. I bought it to clean ink from pens, but I'm loving the ability to clean my mouthguard and my eyeglasses without touching the lenses at all. I ultrasonic clean my eyeglasses with a little detergent, remove the glasses and rinse them off, pound them on a folded towel to remove water from the frames, and then blot the lenses carefully with a few squares of toilet paper to remove remaining tiny water droplets from the lenses.
customer_reviews.author: bfchris

customer_reviews.title: If you wesr glasses you need one of these
customer_reviews.text: I had been to Tokyo recently and an eyeglass shop had one of these outside for people to use free of charge. My glasses had never been so clean. When I returned to the states I looked for one to buy and this looked like a good deal. I also purchased the liquid cleaner with it. I couldn't be happier. Not only are the lenses clean but so are the frames. I gave also cleaned my stainless steel watch and it shines like new. Will try it on some jewelry later. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Happy & retired 2.0

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I have been too lazy to take my ring to the jeweler since I can never get it looking like new again. I have even tried scrubbing with the gem stick that supposed to get into all the corners I need to clean but I would still see a cloud of soap residue under my diamond. This electronic cleaner works as it says it should. I set my ring for a few cycles and it came out looking like new. The timer runs for about 3 minutes and stops automatically. I've even cleaned glasses with this and everything came out pristine. Good buy! I bought with the blitz gem jewelry cleaning solution.
customer_reviews.author: Sueshi

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Just received my package yesterday & put my inside to see if it could work magic on my ring ... added the water and a few drops of the blitz jewelry cleaner & when u turn it on u can actually see the dirt coming off I did have to take a tooth brush with some blitz to get into Lil cracks up under my ring but it honestly looks brand new! I put it against my wedding band in which I'm not wearing yet bc I'm not married yet & it looks just like the wedding band! Very shiny & clean! Absolutely love it especially for the price! It's no steam cleaner but it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Erika Cabrera

customer_reviews.title: ... clean my earrings but was especially impressed with the fine job it did clearing long-dried ink from a whole ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this to clean my earrings but was especially impressed with the fine job it did clearing long-dried ink from a whole set of expensive Rapidograph pens someone gave me that had been left uncleaned for years and the ink had dried up inside the workings rendering the pens useless. Nobody thought they could be saved, especially the fine-point ones, but I decided to give it a try anyhow, maybe save the larger-point ones in the set. To everyone's surprise this appliance cleaned every single pen in the set. Yay!
customer_reviews.author: E. E.L.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT USE WITH EYE GLASSES
customer_reviews.text: I tried it on my eyeglasses as advertised and it ended up destroying the brand new lenses with patterns of cracks all throughout.
customer_reviews.author: Jblc

customer_reviews.title: Actually works!
customer_reviews.text: Got this 5 yrs ago and it cleaned really well. I used it maybe twice a yr. now, I turn it on and nothing happens except the blue light is on. There isn’t that shaking vibrating thing it used to do to clean it so I thought hmmm well maybe it was just the solution you buy to clean it. It’s been soaking in the solution for 20 min now and it hasn’t gotten clean at all. So, I guess the machine itself does all the cleaning work!
customer_reviews.author: Tyson York

customer_reviews.title: Definitely gives my ring a sparkle
customer_reviews.text: I have a white sapphire e-ring/white gold and have to clean it regularly. You have to clean white sapphires more than diamonds. I decided to try this one and I am very glad I did. People ask me if I got a new ring and I get so many compliments about how beautiful my ring all the time. I used this about twice a month with a drop of dawn and it makes my ring beautiful. I bought cleaner for it but I prefer a drop of dawn.
customer_reviews.author: DMT

customer_reviews.title: works great with just water
customer_reviews.text: I really like this thing. It does exactly what it's supposed to do: it cleans my jewelry. The jewelry store where we purchased my wedding and engagement rings will clean my rings for free, but it's such a hassle. I get the same clean at home now. I originally purchased the recommended cleaning solution, but stopped using it. Regular water works fine. I try to use filtered water though. I wear a lot of lotion and it tends to gunk up my rings, so I run them through a few cycles. The water gets hot after 2-3 cycles, so I feel like it's working to sterilize a bit too. These make a great gift too.
customer_reviews.author: Jonni C

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Lifesaver! I clean my glasses and rings weekly in this with warm water and a little squirt of dawn dish soap. My ring is moissanite with diamonds in 18k white gold and this makes it shine! My peach stone gets really dull and dirty quickly so this keeps it shining like brand new. No water spots on my glasses after! I usually run the three minute cycle twice through.
customer_reviews.author: Carly

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied but not thrilled
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for one ring. It has a lot of spaces on it that gunk can build up. When I first received this product I tossed my ring in it a few times and didn't see much of a result. Then I took a small brush and a little cleaning solution to it and then let it run on one cycle of the Sonic Wave and that is when I noticed a difference. I have not tried it on anything other that jewelry but it is big enough to fit a pair of glasses.
customer_reviews.author: J Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: but based on our experience with the unit we purchased we would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: While it cleans my wife's rings very well, however the second time she used it the buttons, which were clearly poorly glued on just fell off...including the latch part that opens it. We also bought one as a gift for our newly engaged niece. Luckily hers was ok, but based on our experience with the unit we purchased we would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: John&Jen

customer_reviews.title: Really great jewelry cleaner!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this jewelry cleaner. I bought it mainly for earrings I wear constantly, so they end up getting hair products stuck to them. I had tried other "ultrasonic" cleaners which were just poorly made versions of what this is. I ended up cleaning everything I had and some friend's pieces. It leaves your jewelry absolutely sparkling and even did a great job on eyeglasses. When I first purchased this, I wasn't expecting it to be as good as taking your items to a jeweler, but it has surpassed that. Now I use it several times per month and everything looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Beware, it breaks after a few uses...
customer_reviews.text: Bought mid september, used first time end of september, broken already yesterday...4 november. Used Maybe 6-7 times... I am so dissapointed..
customer_reviews.author: Honesty goes longer

customer_reviews.title: Falsely described
customer_reviews.text: This claims to be a Sonic Wave CD-2800 with a power of 60W. I received a Magnasonic CD-2800 that is identical in appearance, other than the brand name, but has 35W power. Today the Magnasonic CD-2800 costs about $10 less than the Sonic Wave, so I paid more money to get less.
customer_reviews.author: Printspal

customer_reviews.title: Does pretty well. I bought it primarily to clean airbrushes and parts.
customer_reviews.text: Does pretty well. I bought it primarily to clean airbrushes and parts. Does a better job on metal and glass than plastic, so far . Did take part of the metalized finish off of a pair of glasses, but they are getting older and the lenses were as clean as when I got them. BE CAREFUL: I emptied and rinsed it and somehow it apparently got wet somehow inside - would not start. I had to set it out in the sun for a few ours to dry it up, and it works again.
customer_reviews.author: CGI is the "new" lazy

customer_reviews.title: Eyeglass cleaner?  I don't think so.
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't even begin to clean eyeglasses. It won't even take off smudges from fingers, or eyelashes. Not even splashes from tears. Totally useless.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lund

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good cleaner
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't clean as well as my previous sharper image cleaner worked but is larger and holds more stuff. I like the fact that it has a lid. I wish the holes in the plastic basket were smaller. I have diamond studs that continually fall through the holes. I would also like for the basket to have a small handle so you can lift it out without getting cleaning fluid all over your fingers. I usually run it 2-3 times with straight windex, I do still sometimes have to brush them to get them truly clean.
customer_reviews.author: Dog lover!

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for Basic Cleaning
customer_reviews.text: Good for basic cleaning. I use it for my eyeglasses and some pieces of jewelry. As other reviews say, it's very important to use with some gentle cleaner and hot water. Does not remove tarnish. It's rather awkward to empty, as you have to pick up the whole machine & dump it in the sink.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Forest

customer_reviews.title: Only runs for about 2 minutes per cycle :(
customer_reviews.text: I’m not an expert on jewelry cleaning or owning jewelry for that matter. But I’m pretty sure the unit needs to run for more than 2 minutes. I bought this to use when I make my own vape juice. It’s supposed to shake the juice on a molecular level. Only this model (or just mine) only works for about 2 minutes and then I have to restart it.
customer_reviews.author: WaltC.GA

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY! BROKE AFTER A FEW USES.
customer_reviews.text: DON NOT BUY this piece of crap! I have used it less than 10 times to clean my wedding ring and it just stopped working. When plugged in the blue light that illuminates the cleaning fluid will light up but it will not turn on. Cheap & worthless.
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: Yes.  You really DO only need water
customer_reviews.text: The appliance works so well, I ended up cleaning everything in my jewelry box, including the retro costume jewelry I was concerned could be damaged by harsh chemicals. Bright stones; gleaming metals. I did run some things through multiple times, but that was because they were gunky after all the years.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Daily

customer_reviews.title: Simply works
customer_reviews.text: For the price it doesn't get any better. You can spend a bit more on a model that has different timers. However I found that this unit worked just fine. I cleaned wedding rings, gold chains, imitation jewellery, watches, earrings, eyeglasses and many other small items. This cleaner makes them look great! Is filled the tank up with regular tap water to the recommended line, added a bit (like 2 drops) of dish soap, and immediately the gunk came off of the items. The timer runs for about 3 minutes, let it work it's magic, take your items out of the basket and rinse them, dry them and admire your now sparkling jewelry!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: so my rings get dirty fast). The thing works amazingly
customer_reviews.text: I got this to clean my engagement ring to avoid going to the jeweler constantly (I am a bit of an obsessive lotion user, so my rings get dirty fast). The thing works amazingly! I clean my ring constantly and love how sparkly it is. I've also cleaned some CZ costume jewelry and sterling silver, all with amazing result. I do use very hot water (just off the tap) and a drop or two of dawn dish soap (I doubt the brand matters, I just wouldn't use anything too hard). Depending how dirty something is, I will run it anywhere from one to three cycles. I've been very happy with this cleaner, and would recommend it to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: CA AZ

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw?
customer_reviews.text: I've had 2 of these. While they clean jewelry well, the "window" on the top starts cracking for no apparent reason. I also bought one for my daughter and he's did the same.
customer_reviews.author: Keith  S  Eldred  Jr

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: This machine works GREAT! I bought one for our son's wife and she immediately started cleaning all her jewelry, then started in on his. It does work well. Not quite as good as the professional cleaner at our jewelers, but it's a lot more convenient. I bought one for myself about 8 years ago and it is still going strong. Looks exactly like this one. I do recommend putting a very small amount of Palmolive or other gentle dish soap and use hot water. It helps clean the jewelry better. Be sure to wipe out the base after cleaning, don't leave all the dirt and grime at the bottom or it's a lot harder to get out when dry.
customer_reviews.author: J. K.

customer_reviews.title: So I got this hoping it would be a good alternative to having to use a small brush to ...
customer_reviews.text: So I got this hoping it would be a good alternative to having to use a small brush to clean under the diamond in my engagement ring, unfortunately not quite as effective as I'd hoped. I might actually return it if I can... I don't know how well it works with other jewelry but after two cleaning cycles I pulled my ring out and rinsed it off and dried it, and I could still see oily residue dulling the brilliance of my ring so I added blitz cleaner to the mix and ran it for three minutes...No go...Finally just used a brush
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Better than I would have guessed.  Surprisingly effective.
customer_reviews.text: Again, another item I bought as what I thought was a gimmick, and it ended up being pretty cool. It does seem to work pretty well. Give your jewelry a quick brushing with a cleaning tool and then run it through this. It really does come out looking pretty awesome. Nothing compared to a professional cleaning, but pretty awesome for ten minutes at home. I use warm water and add a touch of dish soap to the water. Seems to be a little more effective. All my friends want to clean their wedding rings whenever they come over. Wish it had a quarter slot so I could make my money back :)
customer_reviews.author: A. Shank

customer_reviews.title: The size is small and it's really hard for me ...
customer_reviews.text: The size is small and it's really hard for me to tell if it works. I tried it on some diamond earrings that I wear all the time, and they seem sparkly. I cleaned one to compare to the other one, and it really didn't appear that different. Other wrote that maybe the wattage or output isn't as strong. I also used it with some silver rolo bracelets and I saw a noticble difference on them. I won't return it, it's not worth my time and effort. So I'm on the fence right now. Will check back in with other items that I try. I used it with no dishwashing liquid and then with a few drops of it.
customer_reviews.author: GSD

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: It does a pretty good job but I have an antique ring with filigree that gets really cruddy on the underside. The cleaner did not get that gunk off. The best way to clean that ring is to blast it with hot steam from my steamer. I was hoping this cleaner would save me that task, but it doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: Kangi

customer_reviews.title: Must have product!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so cool! I've cleaned my wedding rings and watches along with some watches, rings and necklaces that belong to a friend. I bought Connoisseurs Sonic Cleaner to go with it and I feel like using a cleaning solution with it makes a huge difference and gets the jewelry much cleaner. The items sparkle just like new! One little note: my Fossil watch has little crystals around the bezel and I've worn the watch everyday for 2.5 years without losing a crystal and the day after I cleaned my watch in this I lost a crystal so I'm kinda bummed...not sure if this product loosened the crystal or if it's just a coincidence.
customer_reviews.author: janel867

customer_reviews.title: Get your jar with dawn dish detergent and baking soda out.  It works better than this product
customer_reviews.text: I've had this product since late October, 2013 (it is now early January, 2014). I've used it approximately 8 times and always emptied and cleaned it after use. Went to use it today and it won't work. The blue light comes on but nothing happens when you push the "on" button. Can't return it either I guess. I consider this to be a waste of money. When it did work, it did an adequate job but not nearly what I expected. I've cleaned my jewelry in a jar with baking soda and dish detergent for years. Cost me nothing. Guess I'll go back to that because this product has been a disappointment and a rip off.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy K

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, very happy with how well it cleans jewelry
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to clean jewelry, specifically diamond rings and such. This cleaner works as advertised. I just put in water and a drop of liquid detergent (you can run this with just water if you like). It runs for three minutes and automatically stops. After that, I use a toothbrush the gently scrub the jewelry and give it a final rinse in water. On diamonds, you can definitely see the difference! So far I'm very happy with it and recommend it for jewelry cleaning. The sound is not really loud and the build quality is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Chan

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 5 uses
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well for a handful of times. I use it once every few months and I've owned it for about a year and a half. When I turned it on today, the light came on but nothing happened...no vibration. Very good price, but for me the usage I got out of it was not worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this machine because I have a huge problem keeping my eyeglasses clean. This ultrasonic machine works perfectly! I pop my glasses in with just some water and a drop of dish detergent while my coffee is brewing and a couple minutes later, they come out perfectly clean and ready for the day. I have cleaned all the jewelry I own, my glasses, and a few other random things from around the house and I have been extremely pleased with the results. It takes just a few minutes, it shuts off by itself and it does a wonderful job. I'm so glad I found this item!
customer_reviews.author: Mona

customer_reviews.title: Effective and fun to use!
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing. I safely clean my new engagement ring once/twice per week while I shower and its done within minutes. I did buy cleaner to add to the water but have since learned a few drops of gentle soap works just as well. I have also cleaned glasses/ sunglasses/earings/ necklaces etc anything and everything and it shines like new. The run cycle only takes 3 minutes and if you want a little more hit the button again and let it run through the cycle again. You can also see through the top and watch the utrasonic waves cleaning your precious pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Barely lasted a year before it stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this product for just over a year. It worked initially. I didn’t find it remarkable but it was able to do some basic cleaning. Recently , I tried to use it again but found that the machine wouldn’t start up at all. No amount of troubleshooting helped. I contacted the seller who politely reiterated that they only accept returns up to 30 days and the manufacturer warranty is one year. Since I’ve just passed the one year mark, I have no recourse. I would not recommend this product and strongly suggest that potential buyers consider another more reliable product.
customer_reviews.author: Ho C.

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality and effective ultrasonic cleaner. Perfect for jewelry, glasses, and other small objects.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this unit for some time now. I was a little concerned that the quality wouldn't be too good due to the reasonable price. However, this unit exceeds my expectations. The tank is stainless steel. Everything fits well. The unit does a spectacular job cleaning glasses, jewelry, and some stainless steel items that can accumulate body oils and dirt in difficult-to-clean spots. Simply fill the tank with hot water, add some ultrasonic cleaning concentrate and you are ready. The unit runs quietly, just making a quiet buzzing sound. I'm very happy with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Bob W

customer_reviews.title: Works fine on jewelry, not so much on sunglasses
customer_reviews.text: Works well on jewelry, not as magical or amazing as other reviewers would have you believe, just adequate but that's fine because that's all I was looking for. Only word of caution and reason for not giving it four or five stars is that I would recommend against putting sunglass lenses in the machine, the frames got clean but the film on the lenses (and very high quality ones here, ~$400) started to separate in one corner after using this machine to clean them. In the future I will be removing the lenses and only using this to clean the frames.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Great multipurpose Ultrasonic Cleaner
customer_reviews.text: I've been running around cleaning any/everything that can fit into this cleaner. I am thoroughly impressed. I received this as a birthday gift along with new jewelry and I can honestly say this save me some serious time. With no effort it returns items to a brilliant shine. I've have decent luck in plain warm/hot water but my "recipe" is an addition two cap fulls of my jewelry solution (Connoisseurs Sonic Machine Concentrate) and the results are amazing. I have been using this for over a month now and will update if necessary. I would recommend this to those looking for a great ultrasonic cleaner at an even better price.
customer_reviews.author: Gi Fine

customer_reviews.title: Wife loves this, no more trips to the mall ...
customer_reviews.text: Wife loves this , no more trips to the mall to get her jewelry cleaned ...lol ..just dont do one pass at it ..do about 3 to 4 ..or until dirt stops coming off. then one time every other week ..to maintain. CAUTION cheap jewelry will have their crystals/stones off them..tried with some regular jewelry and a bracelet (will not give name but times with ..dora) and all the little crystals where at the bottom of the plate ...also a cheap emerald gold ring had the emeralds out of their sockets. All other named brand (not cheap) stay ok.
customer_reviews.author: rglaredo

customer_reviews.title: Shiny things-- 8 months later and it's dead.
customer_reviews.text: Update: it is no longer working. I used it normally. Not Every day. I used it a few times today and now it's dead. Disappointed. I have a lot of earrings and face jewelry. This keeps them shiny. It also cleans my glass pipes. Very pleased. I wish there was a longer cycle, but it still seems to get the job done when using a jewelry cleaner in combination.
customer_reviews.author: newgarbagetruck

customer_reviews.title: If you are looking to clean your jewelry occasionally then this one is fine. It will not hold up to a great ...
customer_reviews.text: This jewelry cleaner is adequate. The first one I bought stopped working so I contacted the seller who asked me to ship it to them. I did and then received either a new one or repaired cleaner. They did not state which. If you are looking to clean your jewelry occasionally then this one is fine. It will not hold up to a great deal of wear. I found the customer service to be lower quality because they did not explain what the problem was and I think they should offer return shipping if it is within the warranty period.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Don't be fooled into paying more...
customer_reviews.text: Why pay more for a machine that does everything this one does when this ultrasonic is affordable and does a phenomenal job! I was hesitant on buying this because the price was lower (by beetween $50.00 and $70.00) than the others I was looking at; I though there was no way it could do as well as the pricey ones. I was so wrong!! Between this ultrasonic cleaner and my Caribbean Gem jewelry care liquid, our jewelry always looks just as good as the day it came out of the box! I love this little machine- it even come with a watch bridge so you can clean your watches without them being submerged. Awesome buy!
customer_reviews.author: JustJoss

customer_reviews.title: I finally purchased one of these and absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.text: I finally purchased one of these and absolutely love it!!!! Two of us wear Night Guards and an orthodontic retainer, and I cleaned all of my jewelry and a water resistant watch. Everything came out beautiful. I used a Polident tablet for dental appliances and warm to hot water and a little liquid soap for the jewelry. That's it. Did multiple 3 minute intervals. Product exactly as represented and I usually never take time to review but felt I had to. And I'm a dental hygienist. I'm telling all my patients about this cleaner so they don't have to bring it to me to do!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Sonic Cleaner at an even more Fantastic Price!  Cheaper than buying at Walmart!
customer_reviews.text: Works FANTASTIC, and at a fraction of the price of the more expensive models. I've cleaned most of my jewelry and my prescription glasses in this and it is awesome! I put some warm water and a couple drops of Palmolive Dish Soap in, turned it on, and Voila! I run it through two cycles just to get everything out. After cleaning something, you can see an Oil Slick floating around in the water. This proves what came out of your items. My rings shine nice just like I had taken them to the jeweler for cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: SuperSport

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This did not clean my white gold and diamond wedding rings, nor did it clean my sterling silver jewelry. My rings do not look nearly as bright and shiny was when I have them professionally cleaned, and the dullness and tarnish on my sterling silver looks just as bad after cleaning as it did before. I followed the instructions and even purchased jewelry cleaning solution for this machine. It just doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: THP

customer_reviews.title: Love it except for the basket
customer_reviews.text: My only issue with this are that the holes in the basket are quite large for jewelry so you have to be very careful when you rinse items. I really wish this had a finer weave basket. Aside from that if you let it rest for 3 minutes between cleanings, use warm water and dish soap or jewelry cleaner (I always use the cleaner and warm water like review advised) the results are jeweler quality. I definitely recommend this product. This is the cleaner I use:
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: This is the most worthless piece of garbage that you could buy. It does not clean anything, regardless of how many times you run your jewelry through it and regardless of what detergent you put in it. I don't know why I thought I could get something effective on the cheap. Save your money on this and buy something else. If I could return it, I would, but I kept forgetting to open it and as a result I have passed the return date. Totally dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Mom2agr8boy

customer_reviews.title: Works for little tiny pieces well.
customer_reviews.text: Product works well, have not had any issues. I have not cleaned any jewelry with it. Only use it for small intricate parts that are not easy to clean. Appears to be doing what it is supposed to. I do not have any complaints. Seems to be a handy little device.
customer_reviews.author: Will W.

customer_reviews.title: works!
customer_reviews.text: nothing to complain about. Prompt response and delivery, easy to use (laughed at the language problems in the instructions, but they sufficed). My wife had complained about jewelry needing cleaning -- and this device meets the need! Rings and ear dangles sparkle after cleaning! And it even removes the smudges and prints from eyeglass lenses! Neat trays, including one apparantly to allow watch bands to be cleaned while holding the watch out of the solution. Small, compact, well-built. Gonna be a gift to some friends for birthday and other occasions -- bargain at this price.
customer_reviews.author: CDH

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money, but I would spend more for a more vigorous cleaner. Expect multiple cleaning sessions.
customer_reviews.text: Mostly good, but does not really clean superwell. Have to run it 2-3 times. For minor cleanups of jewelry it's good. But for very dirty pieces expect 2-3 runs and don't even think about using it with just water. You will need the cleaning fluid for almost all jobs. For the money it's hard to complain. But I would be willing to spend more on a more vigorous cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Stickman

customer_reviews.title: worth the 27 dollars we spent on product, alone for cleaning my eye glasses
customer_reviews.text: The machine runs in 3 minute cycles. This is a nice time saver compared to using your toothbrush and scrubbing your jewelry with soap. You can put multiple items in the machine to have it clean. Found most my items took 2 cycles. I give this 3 stars because its a time saver from the alternative, plus my eye glass lenses look professionally clean, as if it was the first day i bought them. I would not suggest purchasing this product for more then 30 bucks. it was a disappointment for my jewelry. I could have done a better job using the alternative..... but then again, this is a nice time saver!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yee haw, it cleans stuff and makes it sparkly!
customer_reviews.text: What sorcery is this humming device that brings sparkle to common precious substances and stones? Bought this for my wife and after about 10 minutes she overwhelmed me with praise and kisses for bringing new life to her jewelry box. She uses it with Blitz Gem & Jewelry Cleaner Concentrate which I also bought from the online retailer known as Amazon. Had I know such and inexpensive device would make my wife look at me as some sort of super hero I would have bought it sooner. 2 thumbs up...... 4 if you count hers also!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Great Jewelry Cleaner!
customer_reviews.text: We were fascinated by one of the reviews we had read on the jewelry cleaner and figured if it was half as good as the reviewer made it out to be, we would be in good shape. The great news is that they weren't exaggerating at all! Tip #1 - Don't use the cleaner included, use a couple drops of dish soap. Tip #2 - Use warm water. The machine does the rest! We clean everything that can fit in this thing... Jewelry, eye glasses, keys. It does a great job and is super affordable. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Yankee

customer_reviews.title: HO-HUM...
customer_reviews.text: I have an especially filthy expandable watch band that I wanted to get clean. First tried plain water; sort of worked. Then I tried adding some dish detergent; a little better. Lastly I tried warm water and dish soap; still better BUT not what I was expecting. In as much as this device operates for 3 minutes after the start button is pushed, it took a total of 9 minutes to get to this point. I did see specks of dirt at the bottom of the tank when the cycle had ended and the band removed.
customer_reviews.author: Elwood T. Fudpucker

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: This was purchaced for my dad as a present. He loves it. He picks up things at flea markets and sorts the trash from the treasure. He is excited to use this cleaner on those items. In the mean time he has tried it on all of his jewelry... some of which has set in stones...and is very pleased with the results. He added a cap of cleaner to the water.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle CustomerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Cleans glasses just as well as jewelry
customer_reviews.text: This jewelry cleaner is a little large to sit on the bathroom counter, but it's great for getting glasses really clean. It's also nice to be able to clean a lot of jewelry at once. The only downside I see to it is that the manufacturer wants you to empty it after each use. That's a pain and is a waste if you just let it go down the drain. I funneled it into a bottle the first time, which was a hassle. I'm going to try leaving the solution in it next time and take my chances. So far, it does a great job of cleaning!
customer_reviews.author: fortherelax

customer_reviews.title: most amazing thing thing ive ever bought off of amazon yet.
customer_reviews.text: i cleaned everything i could put in there the first hour i got it. jewelry that looks clean to the eye is not after i put some in there and ran it twice the water was cloudy from the debris stuck on to jewelry. i put new water in there and then put my toothbrush head in there (only a month old) most disturbing thing ever, the water was full of debris, i even ran it a few time with mouthwash in the water to disinfect it it was so gross. best thing ive bought from amazon so far. would defiantly recommend this machine its amazing
customer_reviews.author: mcnick311

customer_reviews.title: Good for Jewelry!
customer_reviews.text: I have collected quite a bit of jewelry through the years. I didn't wear many diamond rings since the diamonds looked dingy, not as attractive as when you first had it. Finally someone suggested this ultrasonic cleaner. First, I read the reviews on this cleaner and decided to take a chance. Well, I must say that after using this cleaner on my jewelry, I could not be happier!! It took all the dingy out and left rings that shine bright and almost look new! I am a happy camper and might even order the more expensive unit, but not right now - I am happy with this unit!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: love it! just got it today and cleaned all my jewelry one of them was tarnished it isn't real gold anyway but it looked brand new! Also all my real jewelry was cleaned as well they all look show room floor new so sparkly love how the diamonds just shine and sparkle. I got it on sale for 25.00 wait for it to go on sale before you buy my personal opinion =)
customer_reviews.author: michelle

customer_reviews.title: A solid little cleaner.
customer_reviews.text: I got this cleaner to clean brass (for reloading). So far, it has done what I expected. Having cleaned quite a bit of brass there are some features that I would much rather have... like more options than just a 3 minute timer. As far as cleaning ability, this little guy definitely has "sweet spots" that clean better than others. From my research, that just happens with these 40kHz models, but it is definitely pronounced when cleaning lots of little things (like brass!) For cleaning things like glasses, my wife's jewelry, and the occasional other item, it works well. Recommended for little stuff and also small amounts of reloading brass (if that is your thing.)
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Vahalik

customer_reviews.title: Where are the five stars coming from?
customer_reviews.text: I'm sorry, folks. I've tried and tried to make this work, but it just doesn't. I've sent silver napkin rings through SEVEN times today, and there is absolutely no difference in them than when I put them in to treat. Took one out, sprayed it with silver cleaner, and it shines. I was so excited when I first got this sonic wave cleaner, I did my rings. Five times. Nothing. I would return it if I could, but thought after we got back from a trip, I would try again because of all the five star reviews. Money wasted, imo.
customer_reviews.author: USA Patriot

customer_reviews.title: Great for cleaning retainers, too!
customer_reviews.text: My mother and I have been using Sonic Wave ultrasonic cleaners to clean and disinfect our Invisalign retainers throughout treatment and retention. They really get the job done and spare us some of what feels like constant brushing throughout the Invisalign process. The auto shutoff gave out on one of the machines, but my guess is it got water into the electronics. I just wish they were easier to clean. It would be amazing if the entire inner bowl could be removed and put in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: K. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Its pretty cheap - so you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in August of 2015 and a few weeks ago (in April 2017) it stopped working. The little machine no longer vibrates at all, so the jewelry just sits there and doesn't get the benefit of the ultrasonic cleaning. Its pretty cheap - so you get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Eliza

customer_reviews.title: ultrasonic?
customer_reviews.text: This machine is supposed to clean things (jewelry, in my case) in plain water. I have not seen any appreciable "cleansing" when I've used water in the machine. I supposed I'll have to buy some special cleaning solution and try it. The little flyer that comes with it fails to describe at least one of the parts that arrived with the machine - a curved piece of plastic, whose use is not mentioned. Someone who speaks English ought to edit the brochure before its printed. Also, there's no mention of where the machine may be returned if it requires service.
customer_reviews.author: margretmh

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: I clean my engagement and wedding rings in here about once a week. It keeps them looking great. When my mom came to visit I had to run hers through 3 or 4 times to make a real difference (she hadn't had them cleaned in > 10 years) but she was flabbergasted. She said she hadn't seem them that clean since I was born! :D based on reviews here, I use warm water and add a tiny drop of dishwashing soap. It's small enough, I keep it in a kitchen cabinet on a small shelf. Out of the way. I don't like lots of appliance clutter, and this doesn't add to anything. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Not a professional cleaner.
customer_reviews.text: Did not find this cleaner to be professional nor ultrasonic. It looks good and came well packaged but when turned on, it buzzes and a nice blue LED enluminates the item inside. I added some detergent to the water with not much results. Wanted to use it to clean technical pen nibs ( Staedtler Mars Matic 700's ).
customer_reviews.author: PJB The Artist

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for glasses
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to clean my glasses, which after years of use have built up grime on the stems and around the lenses. Unfortunately, it doesn't do anything for this. I ran several pairs through for several cycles and they look exactly the same. Even worse, it seems to have removed some of the anti-reflective coating on the lenses. So now I'm going to have to buy new lenses because I've got permanent smudges where the anti-reflective coating used to be. Not cool.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Morris

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. I am officially obessed I go through my jewerly box every month and clean everything. This machine makes my egagement ring and wedding band spark like crazy. The best money I have ever spent hands down. Also please for the people who r pissed off because it doesn't clean with just water, you can not just put water and expect it to clean, you wouldn't put dirty clothes in a laundry machine and expect it to clean with no soap. The key solution is water a few drops of dishsoap and rubbing acohol. Anyone who thinks this machine doesn't work is crazy
customer_reviews.author: C.A

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money..
customer_reviews.text: Used it to clean harmonicas, coins and spectacles. A TOTAL waste of money. Does not clean !! I’m returning it after 3 days.. Hope I get my money back..
customer_reviews.author: David Miller

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Nib Cleaner, Too
customer_reviews.text: Cleaning dried India ink from dip nibs is a difficult and important task. I searched several stores and websites and chose the Magnasonic based on perceived value. This is a well made machine. It feels solid, not light like some I handled, and the overall feel and balance gave a feeling of security - that I wouldn't be leaking black inky goo on my work surface. This machine I'm sure would be an excellent jewelry cleaner - the 3 minute cycle when using a diluted nib cleaner brought my nibs back to brand-new. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jack16

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This little cleaner gets the job done quickly and efficiently. Excellent price and value. It is sturdy and well made - a better value than you can buy in the stores. My jewellery shines like never before. I have never gotten this kind of clean by scrubbing with plain soap and water or even jewellery cleaner from the stores. I was shocked at how murky the water was after cleaning my watch. I didn't know how dirty it was. By looking at the sediments left behind in the water after cleaning, It was obvious that it got the job done.
customer_reviews.author: T. Baker

customer_reviews.title: SCORE!!!  What an awesome piece of equipment!
customer_reviews.text: Professional results for such an inexpensive product. I still cannot believe what great sparkle, shine and results I get on my diamonds, gold, silver...even my costume jewelry shines like the sun! My ex-husband bought me moissanite earrings that would fool even the best jeweler after being cleaned with this! I still wear them and they look awesome! Even my watchband and eyeglasses look spectacular! You'd be a fool if you think you can get a better deal with better results with something else!
customer_reviews.author: Lynnette Shimmin

customer_reviews.title: Specs and description not as listed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife because she owns several pieces of jewelry with small designs and they are very hard to clean. I chose this item because of price and features. If I would have known that what I was being sent was not a Sonic Wave CD-2800 but a generic knockoff and that it does not have digital display nor 5 settings, I would have paid little more for another item. Worked ok, but had run several cycles in order to properly get items clean. Watch out, look closer at the image rather than th item's description
customer_reviews.author: Hamed Negron

customer_reviews.title: Didn't clean hardly at all
customer_reviews.text: This didn't do anything for me. I wear a lot of makeup, so my sunglasses are always caked with foundation (gross, I know). This didn't make any difference. It was as if I had just dipped them in a bowl of water and took them out. I then tried my sterling silver monogram necklace. Again, zero difference. After putting it in the cleaner, I took it out and it still had marks on it. I'm going to stick with soap and water and windex for my sunglasses and jewelry.
customer_reviews.author: Lizette627

customer_reviews.title: I love everything about this
customer_reviews.text: I use this almost daily to clean my engagement ring and wedding bands. I also use it to clean my glasses and my husband's band. Great machine. Can't beat the cost. Only caution that if you have a loose stone, do not use this machine! The directions say as much. But, I don't always listen. I used this to clean my mom's watch which was worn daily the last 15+ years. It took three goes. But, you could see the gunk rising off the band. My rings are so sparkly when I'm done that friends ask me to clean their jewelry for them.
customer_reviews.author: sewbaby

customer_reviews.title: Good for Short Term
customer_reviews.text: Seems to do the job. It is used for a mouth appliance and cleans if effectively with a tablet of Polident. Have not tried it for anything else, such as jewelry or metalic cleaning. UPDATE: After a couple years, the wires in the lid hinge area (I'm assuming) must have broken, because the stop button and power light stopped working and then the blue (UV?) light went out soon after. This product does not have longevity. Therefore, I am downgrading this product from good to only sub-par.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: we have two, one to clean jewelry and the other we use cleaning parts of fishing reels from the wear in salt water, works great for both things
customer_reviews.author: Love My Tires

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I always thought these things were super expensive until I was at my sister's house and she pulled one of these out to clean my wife's rings. I asked her what she paid and where she got it after seeing how well it cleaned rings, glasses, pretty much anything that you can fit inside the basin. I was floored when she told me the price - like I said, I expected it to cost way more! Definitely a great value, I highly recommend this for anyone with everything from glasses to jewelry to clean - does a great job!
customer_reviews.author: Hiram Yates

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a life saver for my sleep apnea mouthpiece. Before I had to scrub the mouthpiece and risked cracking it at times. The mouthpiece has cracked twice and has been sent for repairs. This ultrasonic cleaner has taken care of that problem all together. It cleans the mouthpiece better than when I scrubbed it with a toothbrush and it keeps it from getting cracked. It has been an awesome cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: BTW

customer_reviews.title: Cleans jewelry perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing machine that makes your jewelry REALLY sparkle! I use it with just a little dish detergent in the water and do the process twice. I have a silver ring with an aquamarine stone that has been cloudy for years. I have tried every way I know to clean it and nothing took the cloud out of the aquamarine but this did! And silver and gold shine like they are steam cleaned. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jan in Pittsburgh

customer_reviews.title: doesnt last very long
customer_reviews.text: Breaks fairly fast and design is partly the issue. For cleaning purposes emptying the tank makes it difficult to do without getting the entire unit wet which im sure causes water to get internal and break.
customer_reviews.author: zahid khan

customer_reviews.title: good for glasses; not jewelry
customer_reviews.text: didn't really clean my jewelry as well as expected - nothing like what the other reviews said. glasses were ok; not as good as the old sharper image cleaner I had years ago. wish I could find that one!
customer_reviews.author: Shopper123

customer_reviews.title: Yeeeeeessss!!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! I cleaned my ring all the time with a baby toothbrush and dawn. It looked good. I bought this after going to the jeweler and having him clean it. I missed how much it sparkled after he cleaned it so I bought my own. It looks the same as when I walk out of the jewelry store. I drop it in every morning while I'm getting ready for work. I added a little dawn. LOVE IT! It worked well on old tarnished silver too
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Simonelli

customer_reviews.title: NOT As Described
customer_reviews.text: Although the description says "Digital display with 5 preset cleaning cycles and auto shut off'," this unit has only "off" and "on" buttons and one pre-programmed 3-minute cycle. It does not have a digital display. While it will work for my purposes, this seems deceptive. The picture of this item in the listing seems to be accurate, but the list of features definitely is not. Product itself seems okay. If they had not made untrue claims, I would be more satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Careful Shopper

customer_reviews.title: I love it and am glad I bought it
customer_reviews.text: It really does clean your jewelry! I was a little skeptical when I purchased it. Once I used it for the first time, with a few drops of dish soap as suggested in one of the reviews, I love it and am glad I bought it. I definitely wouldn't expect much if you don't use either a few drops of dish soap or a jewelry cleaner. Just wish that the tank was removable for easier clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Jessi L.

customer_reviews.title: It's OK.
customer_reviews.text: Meh. It cleans gold well, if you keep repeating the cycle and add a few drops of dishwater liquid. Silver, not so much. But I was using it to clean soot from a fire off my jewelry, and it did just that - I could see the dark soot in the bottom. But then you need to rinse and shine it up yourself using a cloth. So it only eliminates a small part of the work of cleaning jewelry.
customer_reviews.author: M. Demersseman

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I have used this to clean several watch bands and it worked well. The only complaint I have about it is that it only runs for two minutes and then you have to re-start it if you want to run longer. I have not used it enough to comment on it's longevity. It may not have a very long duty-cycle so using it for extended cycles may burn it out prematurely. I think if you have a lot of heavy duty use for it you may be better off with a higher end model but for occasional light use this unit seems to work well.
customer_reviews.author: StlJim

customer_reviews.title: Good price for good product.
customer_reviews.text: Product came as expected. Worked as well. However, I got this to clean my airbrush and to clean out empty paint bottles and you do need more than the alotted 3 mins to clean them. I used 90% Isopropyl alcohol and it worked better than the hot water that was recommended. Now I just need to use it more often. I give it 5 stars for it at least trying but do recommend to get one with adjustable timer.But I am happy with mine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Cleaner
customer_reviews.text: This jewelry cleaner works beyond my expectations. My husband is a farmer and one of the first things we tried to clean was his watch band. I put the watch band in and when the timer was up I was amazed at the dirt and grime that had come off of it. This was after it had already been "cleaned." The best part is that it uses just water, no harsh chemicals. I would highly recommend this cleaner to anyone who is in the market. It couldn't be any easier to keep your jewelry sparkling like new.
customer_reviews.author: Carla

customer_reviews.title: I can sparkle once again
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job cleaning my jewelry. Be careful what you put in a ultrasonic cleaner it isn't for everything. You can google your type of stone and see if it can take this kind of cleaner. I have been without a cleaner for awhile after the one I had had quit working. Not the same brand. This is a great machine at a very good price. Also with just one size basket you can put larger pieces in which is nice. The one I had before had two smaller baskets limiting how big of a piece you could put in.
customer_reviews.author: Kate D.

customer_reviews.title: Died within 3 years for me.
customer_reviews.text: Bought back in 2016. Used few times a month over that course of time. It suddenly stopped working. Lights up but won’t work. Cleaned okay. Don’t think there’s a warranty on this so buyer beware it won’t last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Just Us

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm! My wife gets many compliments now that her jewelry is sparkling clean. She cleans them on weekends, it's a quick routine, I did one deep clean initially and it's been maintenance cleans ever since. We've been using a drop of dish soap and it works fine. I was contemplating buying professional cleaning solution but I figured I'd try the dish soap first and if it didn't work then order the pro stuff. Dish soap was fine. Use a toothbrush for fine cleaning, then you'll be good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Diego

customer_reviews.title: It worked, but.....
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea why, but it shook itself apart! Lid cracked today, lots of pieces!
customer_reviews.author: Dry Bones

customer_reviews.title: Ruined my night guard
customer_reviews.text: This thing made my night guard taste really bad I need to get a new one. I think this was used with cleaner or chemical and then was resold because it tasted like chemicals!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

product_meta.title: Sonic Wave CD-2800 Ultrasonic Jewelry & Eyeglass Cleaner (White/Gray)(package may vary)
product_meta.description:
Bring Back the Sparkle and Shine
Make your fine jewelry, eyeglasses, precious coins, and other household items sparkle like new with the Magnasonic Cleaner. Using ordinary tap water, this cleaner safely treats your jewelry and avoids the uncertainty of harsh chemicals and rigorous scrubbing while still leaving your items with an irresistible shine. Remove dirt, grime, rust, lime scale, and any residue from jewelry, small parts and hard-to-clean surfaces, and you can even clean items without taking them apart. With its transparent cover and illuminating light, watch first-hand the cleaning power of this cleaner as millions of microscopic cleansing bubbles clean in ways no hand or brush could match!

Easy to Operate
Restore your jewelry back to the day you fell in love with it. Simply fill the tank with water and get professional cleaning results in just 3 minutes. With 42,000 ultrasonic energy waves per second, the vibrations created by the device leave a sparkling shine on even the most stubborn jewelry.

Quiet, Compact, and Built to Last
With a generous 20 oz stainless steel tank (5.4 x 3.6 x 2.1 inches), this device will clean both your fine rings and large eyeglasses alike. Quiet, solid state circuitry and ease of operation make the cleaner an easy choice for anyone looking for a serious shine.

Avoid Expensive Cleaning
The high cost of professional cleaning prevents many people from getting their jewelry cleaned to remove accumulated oils and grease. Make a wedding ring shine for a highly personal anniversary gift. Using ultrasonic cavitation reduces the risk of damaging jewelry settings or losing a stone.

Applications:
Cleans jewelry, necklaces, rings, earrings, bracelets, coins, eyeglasses, keys, diamonds, silverware, metal badges, watchbands, waterproof watches, shaver heads, razor blades, dentures, combs, toothbrushes, valves, nozzles, machine parts, printer heads, and other valuables!

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
